strndup
char* strndup ( const char *  s,
size_t  n 
)

A function to duplicate certain place of string.

Parameters:
s is a pointer of a char array
n is the number of char used for duplication
Returns:
a pointer to duplicated array

Definition at line 20 of file calculate.cpp.

{
  char *result;
  size_t len = strlen (s);

  if (n < len)
    len = n;

  result = (char *) malloc (len + 1);
  if (!result)
    return 0;

  result[len] = '\0';
  return (char *) memcpy (result, s, len);
}
